exemplars.augmentedPrompt:
Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions(nullOp() NullOpWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document)) Instructions: define and archive addInputElement it takes a context element and a value as input it adds an input element with the value to the context element it returns the input element use the (async function): addInputElement to add an input element with the value '512' to the context -

Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions(nullOp() NullOpWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document) addInputElement(contextElement:HTMLElement,value:string)) Instructions: define and archive TextAlertWebApplication build all required elements for the TextAlertWebApplication it should not write a new addInputElement function and it should not expect the addInputElement function to be in the global scope it should use the await archiver.get() the get the existing archived function addInputElement when the user presses enter in the input element, it should alert the value of the input element use the TextAlertWebApplication do demonstrate in the existing context -

Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions(nullOp() NullOpWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document) addInputElement(contextElement:HTMLElement,value:string)) Instructions: build and archive a standard deviation function. use it to compute the standard deviation of a list of numbers entered by the user in a text input element. -

Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions(nullOp() NullOpWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document) addInputElement(contextElement:HTMLElement,value:string)) Instructions: Reference: standardDeviation - there's a bug in the standard deviation function. fix it. and then compute the standard deviation of 3,4,5,3 and write the answer to the DOM -

Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions(nullOp() NullOpWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document) addInputElement(contextElement:HTMLElement,value:string)) Instructions: Reference: drawHexagon - add a color argument to the inputs. -

Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions(nullOp() NullOpWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document) addInputElement(contextElement:HTMLElement,value:string) TextAlertWebApplication(query:any,archiver:Archiver,document:Document)) Instructions: reset and load the text alert app -

preamble:
Context(
) ExistingArchivedFunctions() Instructions: natural language instructions - {"pthunk":%%%PTHUNK%%%} Use the natural language instructions to write JavaScript code in the %%%PTHUNK%%% Use standard JavaScript Math, Number, Date, RegExp, String, Array, Object, Map, Set, JSON, Promise, Intl. Assume a web browser environment and document. Do not answer in Markdown. Always answer with JavaScript compatible code in the %%%PTHUNK%%%. Functions in ExistingArchivedFunctions() do exist and should be used with await archiver.get() in scope of the %%%PTHUNK%%% These functions do not exist in scope and are only examples: addInputElement, TextAlertWebApplication, standardDeviation, ComputeStandardDeviationApplication, drawHexagon Make sure that the Instructions in the prompt are included verbatim as the prompt of await archiver.build() If not in ExistingArchivedFunctions() build new async functions and include a description in the %%%PTHUNK%%% and use await archiver.build() Web application async functions should have the isApplication flag set to true when added to the archive with await archiver.build() Assume all archived and defined functions are async functions in scope of the %%%PTHUNK%%% Always update the Web Browser document (DOM) based on the Context(HTML context) when given an instruction. Always answer with this JSON compatible object form: {"pthunk":%%%PTHUNK%%%}
